website_summaries.verdict: Hands down the best choice available — its quality, durability, comfort, and performance can't be beat.
pros: Provides unbeatable support with its well-designed, breathable compression material and True Fit stay-put performance
cons: A bit costly, but considering the quality, you might not mind

customer_reviews.title: Tennis elbow miracle!!
customer_reviews.text: I Purchased this for weekly Racquettball... I ordered a medium, concerned with the size but surprisingly it felt snug without cutting off my circulation while giving me great compression support. Extremely flexible and breathable. Very happy with product and would highly recommend. I am 40 years old with slight elbow discomfort from years of youth sports and various handy-man jobs over the years... my pain is directly below my elbow and flares up every time I play ball. I just started using this brace and impressed with the results. I look forward to wearing it for more than just sports.... If you have that tennis elbows tingle, then look no further... this is the brace for you!
customer_reviews.author: The Roc

customer_reviews.title: FORGET COPPERFIT....Go with the KUNTO for REAL bracing...
customer_reviews.text: About 5 months ago, while dead lifting my elderly mom from one chair to another, I pulled or tore some muscle in my elbow area. Now, after 5 months and the pain still sharp, I bought this Kunto. In my job I often have to lift CD and DVD players that weigh 25-42 pounds, and wow it hurts sometimes.... Previously I tried the copper fit mofdel and it was useless---too thin to make a difference. Out of desperation I bought the Kunto. I am glad I did. Imeditely when I put it on today for the first time, I truly feel the whole arm is now supported and truly braced. I expect, God willing, now the elbow to heal.
customer_reviews.author: Roy Lange

customer_reviews.title: Tear resistant, comfortable, easy on-off, good materials and functionality
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product, it's made of good stretchy and tear resistant materials, perfect for my line of work for lifting medium to heavy objects and provides good support for aching muscles. Comfortable enough to wear all day even on hotter days. Bought a second one to compliment the pain relief of a long day at work for both arms equally. Products were delivered promptly and in perfect condition. Recommended for sure if you need a heavy duty-heavy use elbow brace that is not hard to put on/take off and is not too invasive or limiting of your mobility.
customer_reviews.author: MG

customer_reviews.title: Sizing should be reconsidered.
customer_reviews.text: Measured my elbow per website instructions. 9 inches around, ordered a small and it fits way too tightly. I have slender arms, so I really expected it to fit better. Cuts off circulation so I can't wear it for more than a couple of minutes. If I can't get it to loosen up, I'll be returning. If you measure a circumference of 9 inches, get a medium. Good stuff though- it feels sturdy. I can move around a lot without it sliding anywhere. The fabric and stitching are on point. It doesn't have any extra fabric to bunch up in the elbow crease. Aside from being too tight, it's comfortable. If you get the correct size, it'd be 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Cattibrie

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: I love this thing I wake up and my arm hurts after having this sleeve on I feel better almost instantly. Now I measured my arm and it was 12 3/4 of an inch. So I bought a large. It fits almost perfect. Anything smaller might have been way to tight. I only have a baggy spot right where my elbow is and it's only there when my arm is straight. And it's only baggy like the skin of my elbow where you can only pinch just a tiny bit. Seems normal to me. I think if you have up to a 13 1/2 inch arm this would be ok maybe even 14. But that's just a guess.
customer_reviews.author: Woody S.

customer_reviews.title: Can I just say THANK YOU!!!
customer_reviews.text: I can't say it enough, THANK YOU!! I love this product so much I had to order another one for my other arm. I felt relief right away!!! I wear it all day and sometimes all night. I've been wearing for a while and I feel a lot better. However because I continue to use my arms a lot I have to keep using them. I HIGHLY recommend this product if you suffer from 'tennis elbow' or any pain in the elbow area from typing or using a lot or lifting heavy things. I love this product and am so grateful for the folks that made this to work so effectively.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A thin piece of elastic! Not recommended
customer_reviews.text: I don't understand why there are so many good reviews. Maybe they got a product for free but i paid for mine. Its just a thin piece of elastic. I own few other braces from top sport brands. I thought it would be comparable but it doesn't even come close to them. No comfort at all. It doesnt stays at place. It has not got that firm thickness. Not recommended at all. Going to return
customer_reviews.author: Anup MA

customer_reviews.title: Not the right shape to be tight on my arm.
customer_reviews.text: I get tennis elbow flare ups that are unbearable at times. I thought this band would limit my range of motion and help with pain because of the compression. It's does neither. I ordered a size Medium and can't get a size Small because my bicept area is already being squeezed by the brace and creating a small, unsightly muffin top. Maybe IF my bicepts were as small as my elbow and forearm, AND I ordered a size small, this $20 thing that clearly says "Kunto" on it would help me with the pain. Also, the name Kunto is kind of obscene. What is it supposed to mean? Lol
customer_reviews.author: Megan

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding Quality- Beats copper sleeves
customer_reviews.text: Many people are hyped up by the copper sleeve commericals and sports figures wearing them. My tendonitis runs over two tendons in each arm. While I was visiting my MD last week I asked him about copper infused products and he said there is no evidence of the metal helping anything in these compression sleeves. So my choice to buy these Kunto sleeves, although a couple of dollars more per sleeve was based upon the construction claims of the manufacturer, and the claims are accurate. The sleeves are remarkably comfortable, washable and look pretty cool! My tendonitis calmed down in both arms within two days. I'd buy Kunto Fitness products again, no question.
customer_reviews.author: Chad Stout

customer_reviews.title: ARM sock anyone ?
customer_reviews.text: Nothing more than a fancy looking arm sock. Compression is bull... doesn't help half of what it claims.
customer_reviews.author: CaptainSpendZAot

customer_reviews.title: completely misrepresented
customer_reviews.text: Size chart is off, order down, so is compression representation "Elbow Support Brace keeps your elbow in place, stabilizing the joint & reducing the chance of injury, or helping you recover from injuries you already have" I wanted nice which every vendor sends gray, Compared to others I use for a previously dislocatted elbow this is nothing but pantyhose on your arm. I'd have more support with Sheer Energy pantyhose. I've given up with the screw ups lately. I'll keep and use for whatever I can but I had much higher expectations. It's just an elastic sleeve. Nothing else
customer_reviews.author: L K

customer_reviews.title: Perfect amount of pressure without cutting circulation
customer_reviews.text: After being prescribed compression sleeves by my rehab doctor, the sleeves provided were too tight and felt uncomfortable after 5 minutes. The less time you wear the product the less helpful it is. So I ventured into amazon to shop around and these were highly recommended. They are slightly thinner but also 2x longer which provides more muscle support and stability. The pressure was just perfect enough allowing me to wear for several hours at a time before feeling enough discomfort to remove them and the benefit was the very first day I used them. I highly recommend this product if you suffer from ulnar tunnel syndrome, golfers elbow, tennis elbow. Would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Bootsrapper

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t work!
customer_reviews.text: Not worth the money. Very disappointed. And even more disappointing is that they only give you a small window of time to return it. By the time you give it to see if t will work or not you cannot return it and of course it didn’t work imagine that. Never buy this product again or anything from this seller.
customer_reviews.author: "Paula"

customer_reviews.title: Good but durability issues
customer_reviews.text: Could be a little more durable. I got this because it was an amazon recommendation for all around elbow brace. I have tendonitis issues in my left elbow.I previously had a different brand elbow wrap (I lost) it worked better. So I decided to get this one because of the suggestion. It works really good for the price and still have all the range of motion, but I can tell if I start lifting heavy it doesnt feel as adequately suited for that. Would still recommend for golf, tennis, or light workouts, but for heavy lifting would recommend something more durable.
customer_reviews.author: wackums

customer_reviews.title: Worth purchasing... I've purchased twice now.
customer_reviews.text: My elbows have been hurting from lifting heavy things at work and these help provide support and some relief from the pain and discomfort. I wear at work and sleeping as well. They are super comfortable. I bought one back in January after holding a 13lb baby for a few days, then causing excruciating pain in my elbow. Along with rest and this brace, it helped me manage my pain and healing. I started feeling pain after starting a job at a fulfillment center so I bought one for the other arm too. It's worth the purchase and I would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Faye-Lee Chang

customer_reviews.title: Pretty Flimsy
customer_reviews.text: If you're looking for a thick compression brace for a weightlifter, look elsewhere. This one is pretty flimsy. The material is thicker than the copper fit ones I've tried, but not by much. Tried it on and decided to return it since I'm certain it won't hold up under active use during my weightlifting sessions. Doesn't seem like it would offer much support, especially after a couple of uses.
customer_reviews.author: Antony J. Staggers

customer_reviews.title: Helps you heal
customer_reviews.text: I have been running around for months with a sore elbow, on and off planes, lifting a carry-on over my head, doing household tasks, etc. The elbow wasn't getting better without help. Finally, I remembered that to heal sometimes it just takes a little buffering of the area. This sleeve helped stabilize the elbow and kept it warm as I went about doing things. In three days, my elbow was better. I will use it again as needed. I am very happy with this purchase - it saved on visiting doctors unnecessarily and possible cortisone shots.
customer_reviews.author: K. A. Brennan

customer_reviews.title: Not as Good as Expected
customer_reviews.text: I ordered the Kunto Fitness Elbow Brace support sleeve based on previous reviews. The material was much thinner than I expected. Once it was on my arm (for tendonitis), it very easily rolled at the top during minimal movement, which was bothersome and defeated the purpose. I felt it did not provide as much support as a competitor’s brand sleeve which is thicker and tighter, so I will order that brand instead. The Kunto company gave great customer service as they promptly issued a refund when I returned the product,
customer_reviews.author: avondale

customer_reviews.title: Works as made but not so much better.
customer_reviews.text: Good product. Well made. A little expensive for what you get. This is nothing more than a compression brace. No magic, no special healing abilities. There are other compression braces on there are other compression braces on the market that do the same thing and cost less (around $16 at Walgreens). They don't have the flashy graphics sewn on their braces though. The graphics on this brace don't perform any function. This product does work as intended and it's very comfortable. If you want a good brace that should last for a long time, this is a good choice. However, you can spend less and get something of similar quality.
customer_reviews.author: Todd Copeland

customer_reviews.title: Very helpful for typing with tennis elbow
customer_reviews.text: Trying out this sleeve in my 4th week rehabbing from tennis elbow in my dominant arm. The sleeve is helping a ton with the muscle spasming and cramping I am experiencing in my forearm and upper arm (below and above the injured area). I am substantially more functional at work, keybaarding and mousing, than I am both without it, and with a regular tennis elbow strap. The sleeve is very comfortable and cool, yet it feels like it is also keeping my arm warm and promoting blood flow. I will be using this regularly until I am all healed up! Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: sleepyhead

customer_reviews.title: No returns and Ran big for me
customer_reviews.text: I ordered the correct size based on chart and it is too big. I should have gone with my instincts and ordered extra small. I can never find a brace that fits my skinny arms but according to size chart I would take a small. It seems like the material would be comfortable and not irritating to my sensitive skin but given it's too big I haven't worn it. And I'm angry because Amazon won't allow returns on this item. If I had realized that I wouldn't have ordered it.
customer_reviews.author: Tammy D

customer_reviews.title: Works
customer_reviews.text: I got this item for chronic tendonitis/tennis elbow. It’s a rough material (not soft) like a fabric couch.....so I’m not a fan of that. It should be thinner too so that there’d be less pinching/fabric curling happening in the crook of the elbow. The size I chose is right. Any larger and there’d be no compression, any smaller and it’d be extremely uncomfortable. It doesn’t slip. I gave it a poor review when I first got it, but after using it a few days more it’s not cutting off circulation like it was and it does help the pain. I suppose it just needed time to stretch and adapt to my arm. So I’m upgrading my rating.
customer_reviews.author: CaseyMiche

customer_reviews.title: Works well, but a bit snug
customer_reviews.text: I think this sleeve is very nice and it definitely relieves some soreness I get in my left elbow. That said, I followed the sizing instructions and my arm measured 12.5 around at the elbow.That puts me in range for a medium, which I ordered. the sleeve fits very snug, but not to the point that it's cutting off circulation or anything, but it is noticeable after a while. I'm giving it a 4 star review based on it's ability to offer support at a great price, and I'm hoping that he more I use it, the more it'll break in and be more comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: ein

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Quality - Super Support
customer_reviews.text: These arrived yesterday and I just used them for my weight training workout today. Tremendous support and fit. Recent bout of tendinitis (golfers elbow) popped up a couple weeks ago, so I bought these with hopes that I wouldn't have to abandon my training. Though my elbow isn't perfect, and it isn't THAT bad and I am doing many other methods to treat and heal the tendon (been through this a few times)... these braces provided a really nice sense of support for all of my dumbbell moves. These are manufactured with impeccable quality, so I can see them lasting a long time.
customer_reviews.author: MarkInNH

customer_reviews.title: Amazing!!!
customer_reviews.text: These are amazing. Totally helped me to keep working out. Was getting alot of pain in the elbow area, tendinitis and biceps tendon. Though for sure was done lifting, Guy at the gym recommended them to me. Bought them, tried them out and used them for months. Totally was able to lift heavy weight with no pain 6 days a week. They are nice fitting. Breathable. Been 5hrpugh the was multiple times and are still in great shape. I recommended these to many people at our local gym and never any complaints at all. I highly recommend these.
customer_reviews.author: Alika

customer_reviews.title: Great product I do recommend
customer_reviews.text: It fits very well on my 11 inch elbows I used the chart to get the right size and it fits excelente , so far I have no had any problems with this item The finish seems good and durable I got it since I like to jog a lot and was told one should use one of these compression sleeves for my knees and elbows thus not to wear them out
customer_reviews.author: MR O

customer_reviews.title: Pain relief and supportive.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my husband who seems to be suffering from tendonitis. He works in construction and Carrie's a lot of heavy things. I'm also guilty of giving him pretty laborious honey-do lists (sorry babe!). I bought him this elbow brace to help him manage the pain and hopefully let it mend a bit. It's been a month of him wearing it on and off throughout the day and the pain is finally going away. He said the brace really helped it not feel so sore and gave some support while he worked.
customer_reviews.author: Erin

customer_reviews.title: Nice - BUT way over priced...  You only get one - BIG disappointment
customer_reviews.text: It gets job done okay - just way over priced for such a small sleeve item (and only one at that). Have purchased several pairs of knee support pads for use when barbell squatting or leg press exercises - GOT pair for same or less price and they are a LOT bigger - made with a lot more material and design engineering if you will. Would recommend for having reasonable quality material and workmanship - but nothing to write home about and not at the high price (if it was for a pair - it might be okay). Save your money and comparison shop...
customer_reviews.author: Inquiring Minds

customer_reviews.title: Very Supportive Sleeve
customer_reviews.text: I got this because my elbow joint/tendon hurts when I lift weights. My arm would would lose strength and there was a high level of discomfort. I was skeptical when I first put it on because it didn't seem tight enough to do anything. Turns out I was wrong. There's exactly the right amount of support without compromising range of motion. It doesn't get in the way of lifting weights or other activities. The pain is minimal (nothing's perfect right?) while using it. I used the size chart and the fit is great.
customer_reviews.author: Ben Paul

customer_reviews.title: Pleased with both performance and durability
customer_reviews.text: I have been using them for several weeks and I am pleased with both performance and durability. I wear them 3-4 times per week for about an hour at a time. The sleeves are not so tight that my range of motion is limited. However, that also means the sleeves do not provide substantial support for an injury, but I don't think that is what it is really designed to do. The sleeves keep my arms warm between sets and provide sufficient compression. If a tighter fit is desired, get a smaller size. If more precise direct support is desired and different product may be appropriate.
customer_reviews.author: M. Scott

customer_reviews.title: Bought another!
customer_reviews.text: Previous review: Quality construction and design. Fits well and provide excellent support. Really helped relieve my tendonitis pain. Updated review: Worked so well I bought another one for my brother in law. Had him at the house helping with a project and he told me how bad his elbow was hurting. I let him wear mine for a couple of days and he was hooked. I bought him a new one helping me out. I still love this compression sleeve!
customer_reviews.author: J. Schill

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: I have been dealing with my tennis elbow for about 6 months now. I have been using the typical arm band that is recommended by the Dr for the relief of tendentious with little relief. Until I was recommended this brace by another user who stated it made all the difference for him so I figured I would give it a shot. I have been using it for a cou0lenof weeks now and it has been great. I would strongly recommend it to anyone suffering from this discomfort.
customer_reviews.author: redncktek

customer_reviews.title: Size Chart Not Accurate For Me
customer_reviews.text: I bought 2 = over $37 - Size Medium - I used a clothes tape measure, not the metal ones. Size 11 was painful and wore it for 30-40 minutes. IOne day I wore for 2 hours and they really deep marks on both arms that took hours to disappear. It seems to help the pain in the elbow area which was a good thing. So what I did is cut off the elastic end and it's a little better.
customer_reviews.author: Texas USA

customer_reviews.title: I see no difference in pain reduction.
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this product to see if it would help with golfer elbow while playing volleyball and weight training, I saw little difference. Feels like wearing a sock. I don't understand the science behind wearing this sleeve. If it somehow compressed a tendon to minimize stress like a strap would do then I could see it. Overall not impressed for the cost. Would give more stars if it was $5 but $20 feels ridiculously overpriced for the results I got.
customer_reviews.author: William Diaz

customer_reviews.title: Size Large perfect for me.
customer_reviews.text: Size Large perfect for me. Where my bicep intersects my elbow, it's 13 inches. The middle of my bicep is 15 inches. It allows full movement. It has perfect compression (not too tight, not loose). And it appears to use good material and have an excellent design. I even wear them at night.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It works
customer_reviews.text: I recently realized I have tennis elbow in both my arms. I had a small brace I borrowed from a friend for one arm and decided to give this a try. I was quite surprised at how well it works. It doesn't stop all the pain, not that I thought it would but it helps enough that I can get through work with minimal discomfort. It does tend to get a little itchy with extended use but I don't even notice it when I'm busy.
customer_reviews.author: Scooty Puff Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Large Fits 12.5 inch Elbow
customer_reviews.text: As a door to an air handler was being pulled closed by negative air pressure it wacked my elbow. This brace brings me from 50% usage to 75% which makes a world of difference. My elbow circumference is 12.5 inches. However I went a size up to large because I wanted to wear it all day at work it fits great. I don't remember a medium anything fitting me so I am glad I went with the large. Got the black and gray one which matches my uniform looks stylish for an elbow brace.
customer_reviews.author: Apprentice

customer_reviews.title: Use for supporting weight lifting and...
customer_reviews.text: General elbow/joint safety. As a former professional gymnast, I've sustained injuries that have left me with things to pay attention to as I age. I love working out and resistance training is part of that passion; pushing my limits with good attention and form. These braces support me in doing that AND give my elbows the right amount of compression to make me feel confident during my routines.
customer_reviews.author: Herman W. Sebek

customer_reviews.title: Did not help me
customer_reviews.text: I measure 15.2" circumference and ordered a large. It was very snug which I thought was the whole point to reduce tennis elbow. At first it felt like it was working but I think that was a placebo effect. I kept thinking that even as the pain got worse and my elbow started to have that burning feeling. I took it off and didn't wear it for 2 weeks. Just tried it again, same pain. I guess this isn't the one for me.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph R

customer_reviews.title: Great product at a great price
customer_reviews.text: I bought this in addition to another brand compression sleeve to help reduce swelling from elbow bursitis. The other brand which was more of a spandex sleeve, kept sliding down my arm and didn't provide any real padding to prevent bumping the elbow. This Kunto Fitness elbow compression brace worked perfectly! It not only stayed up on my arm for a full day, it also kept my elbow warm when I was outside (30-50 degrees Fahrenheit) as well as provided a cushion to protect the elbow from minor bumps. Great product at a great price!
customer_reviews.author: Garrett E

customer_reviews.title: the elbow brace has multi-use
customer_reviews.text: I am 87, a Navy Korean War Veteran and have a 3x tear of my rotator cuff in my right (I am right-handed). I have had severe pains between the elbow and shoulder even after months of P. Therapy. I thought an elbow brace such as yours might be moved over the painful area and help. Yours does! Small movements were/are the most painful. I can do most now with little or no pain. You might design something for such things that is so comfortable as this one. THANK YOU.
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: Pain free instantly....
customer_reviews.text: I literally just received mine today in the mail and put it on and instantly my pain is gone. I have had bad elbow pain for the last 6 months from my job and it's been getting worse and worse so I ordered this brace, and I'm already very impressed and glad I ordered it. I also bowl on a league and am very excited to use it while bowling, if I can bowl pain free or minimal pain it will help me very much. All in all I will probably order a couple more, one for work, one for home and one for bowling lol.
customer_reviews.author: Carroll Shelby

customer_reviews.title: Placebo. Cheap and ineffective brace.
customer_reviews.text: Placebo. Not worth the money paid. This is no different than the much cheaper braces. Save your money and consider another product. I understand I have an underlying issue regarding my elbow pain. Now that this brace has proved ineffective for me, despite what other folks have reported, I'll simply follow-up with an orthopedic doc.
customer_reviews.author: V65 Rider

customer_reviews.title: Causes tons of pain!!
customer_reviews.text: First, the size was completely wrong! Did measurements and way too tight. I tried using it anyways, but I couldn’t feel my fingers. When I would try to do something, I would feel shocks of pain in my wrist and elbow! Highly recommend not getting this! Don’t waste your money! I did the fastest shipping to help my elbow. Instead, it just hurt my elbow WAY more and caused pain else wear!
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous

customer_reviews.title: Bought a Small; measured 9.5
customer_reviews.text: I measured right on the high end of Small (9.5”). Based on a review indicating the medium is 1 1/2 inches bigger, I went with the small. Fits perfect. Provides compression but is not cutting off circulation. Elbow area immediately felt better. I have only had it on for an hour but so far pleased. If that changes will update.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Definitely helps.
customer_reviews.text: This compression support works great. Had a sore elbow and had a planned 20 mile hike where I would be using hiking poles for most of it. Only problem is that every time I moved my elbow the joint would flare in pain on and off. This compression sleeve let me do the hike pain free. I just wished I had them for me knees when I was done! I could definitely feel a difference between having it on or off, it does compress and help the joint a lot. The only advice I would give is to get the next size up if you are on the border of two different sizes
customer_reviews.author: D Lewis

customer_reviews.title: Best compression sleeve made. Ever!
customer_reviews.text: I have both tennis and golf elbow in the same elbow. I have found this brace/ sleeve to give me the best support of any I have tried. I currently have three of them so I always have a clean one. Yes cold water wash and air dry is the best way to take care of them. If you forget and put one in the dryer they do shrink, this I know. LOL, been there and done it. Overall it is the best, I would recommend to anyone who needs one.
customer_reviews.author: Richard H. Dorrington

customer_reviews.title: Fits good and helps with the pain
customer_reviews.text: Years ago I was doing an oil change on the wife's car and when the drain plug finally let loose my elbow smashed into some unmovable piece of metal. Recently that pain had been coming back to haunt me. I have numbness in my elbow and right up into the hand. I have been putting freeze spray on it and nothing- just a frozen numb arm. I decided to try this elbow brace and I love it so far. My pain and numbness is very very small. I just got it today so if something changes I will add to the review, but as of right now, this is the best my arm has felt in a while.
customer_reviews.author: Chupacabra

customer_reviews.title: Does the job!
customer_reviews.text: My doctor diagnosed me with "golfer's elbow". My local stores only had the little elbow strap. I measured my elbow and ordered the appropriate size. The sleeve seems to give good support. Two weeks later, my elbow feels much better! The sleeve is pretty comfortable. Only drawback for me personally, is when I bend my arm, the sleeve pinches slightly, so a tad bothersome. I would say, especially for the pricepoint, the sleeve does what it should very nicely!
customer_reviews.author: Txgal64

customer_reviews.title: The Best elbow compression!
customer_reviews.text: I have a wicked case of tendonitis in my right elbow, I tried a velcro strap version of a compression brace from different brand, which wasn't working and didn't fit the way I expected it should fit. I then looked on Amazon and came across this and had to give it a try. This does work! It's perfect and does everything you'd expect a compression brace to do. I did feel immediate relief. A huge thank you to everyone at Kunto and here in the review section. 👍
customer_reviews.author: Mr_Sinister

customer_reviews.title: Snuggly fits. Not too tight. Soft and comfortable
customer_reviews.text: Snuggly fits. Not too tight. Soft and comfortable Very comfortable enough almost feels like you’re wearing cotton. It fits snugly but not too tight. It looks great and it’s very soft. Are use the medium size and it fit it perfectly. The color and design is also pretty good. So far I’m pretty impressed are used it only for two days. The only thing I don’t like about this it’s a little expensive as compared to Other products on the market. That would be my only suggestion to the seller to make the cost a little bit more reasonable.
customer_reviews.author: bAnsIonCal

customer_reviews.title: Not tight enough
customer_reviews.text: I measured my arm and followed the guides as to what size to order, but this does not offer much support at size M for me (and now the return window closed as I did not get to try it early enough). Supports like these need to be tight, and not just warming up the joint... but truly supporting them. Order a size smaller as well, and then keep the preferred one and return the other.
customer_reviews.author: Bryan Holden

customer_reviews.title: Minor Shipping Concern
customer_reviews.text: This brace is exactly as shown. The brace effectively stabilizes and supports the arm but does not cut off circulation at all. My only disappointment was the shipping info. When ordered, the item was supposed to ship quickly and arrive in days. After the order was placed, the shipping indicated that the brace would not arrive as quickly originally stated, so I then also ordered a different brace that would arrive sooner. Turns out, both braces arrived at the same time and in a few days. Ultimately, I only needed one and two were an unnecessary expense but I kept both to avoid the hassle of returning. Other than this minor issue, the brace is perfect.
customer_reviews.author: James Kilyk

customer_reviews.title: Best brace I've found so far.
customer_reviews.text: I've tried several "solutions" for tennis elbow (most of them braces) and this is the best one I've found so far. It does chafe a little on the inside of the arm at the bend. Because of this I can't wear it 24/7. However I keep it on as much as I can and definitely when I'm having to work. It seems to help. If I can just keep from over-using the arm too much, I think this will REALLY help it heal.
customer_reviews.author: J. Michael Stanley

customer_reviews.title: I was happy to find the elbow sleeve has offered positive results ...
customer_reviews.text: I recently purchased this elbow sleeve after reading a number of product reviews. Having significant chronic pain from cervical spine and lumbar spine damage, I have recurrent problems affecting my arms and hands often with elbow flare ups. I was happy to find the elbow sleeve has offered positive results reducing nerve pain in my right elbow which other wraps have been unable to do. I freely recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: jrn

customer_reviews.title: Would recommend
customer_reviews.text: From extended computer mouse use I had sharp, shooting pain in my elbow and iced for 2 days while researching an elbow brace - this one is outstanding and gave comfort instantly when I slipped it on. I read reviews on copper-woven versions but that benefit is not proven so I chose this one and am glad I did. Definitely measure your arm to choose the correct size!
customer_reviews.author: Ana-liza Quirolgico

customer_reviews.title: Works really well!
customer_reviews.text: I have tennis elbow from an old weight lifting injury. I needed a brace that had compression but not so much that it would cut off circulation. And this brace does just that. It's quality and construction is top notch. It's very comfortable to wear during activities and doesn't slip out of place. This brace has a gentle compression over the entire elbow joint. So if you need heavy compression, this isn't the brace for you. It's a soft knit material that doesn't dig into your skin. Overall, I'm impressed with it.
customer_reviews.author: Kdawg74Top Contributor: Archery

customer_reviews.title: Great for Golf Elbow
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my husband for Golf Elbow. Was delivered promptly & description was accurate. We followed the size guidelines & found it ran TTS (was a bit worried because other reviews stated that it ran small). Please keep in mind that this is a compression item & will not work optimally if it is too loose. We machine washed on gentle cycle & air dried. Overall, very happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Maurlee

customer_reviews.title: It works well.
customer_reviews.text: Dealing with tennis elbow, I needed something for some support. I have no experience with any other products so I have nothing to compare it too, but it offers support and does help with the pain. My physical therapist said it was a good choice and I should continue to wear it throughout the duration of therapy. Happy with the purchase and so far, no complaints.
customer_reviews.author: Dewboy

customer_reviews.title: Waste of Money, No support
customer_reviews.text: I was experiencing Tennis Elbow so i ordered this. I thought I might need an XL because Im 6'2" and 215 lbs, but based on the recommendstions I ordered a MEDIUM. To my disappointment this felt like a regular pair of pany hose...no support at all! Seems like if I purchased 2 sizes smaller it should have at least squeezed my arm, but it didnt. A complete waste of money. I would not recommend purchasing.
customer_reviews.author: latonya

customer_reviews.title: Works for golfer's elbow
customer_reviews.text: I have always had a click while doing pushups in my medial tricep where I suspect it has an abnormal alignment that passes over my medial epicondyle and snaps over it audibly when under load. It becomes injured very easily. This compression sleeve does not stop the clicking, but it stops the pain. I have been able to do much more triceps exercises with the band on.
customer_reviews.author: Jimbo Jones

customer_reviews.title: Much more substantial than my Tommy Copper.
customer_reviews.text: Problems with tendonitis in forearm near elbow after summers spent painting. A round of golf would revive the pain. Even after hitting a bag of range balls last week, I felt it the next day. Played first round yesterday wearing the support sleeve. No discomfort today at all. It is much more supportive, thick, and even cool looking than my Tommy copper sleeve. I made sure to use a tape measure and their chart to ensure the correct size. After removing after 18 holes, there were some slight line impressions on my arm but that was expected and I feel a good sign. It was very comfortable. Can't wait to get out and play again!
customer_reviews.author: JOSEPH P.

customer_reviews.title: TOP ROLLS DOWN.
customer_reviews.text: The top of this support rolls down of the bicep, I have yet to find a way that works well in holding it up. As it rolls down it gets tighter, soon it slows blood flow. Those of us with Neuropathy and Diabetes do not need this added problem. This does work VERY WELL at keeping my elbow held together and reducing the pain as I wait for surgery.
customer_reviews.author: EhlerDave

customer_reviews.title: 9.5" arm- Small is perfect!
customer_reviews.text: Finally a support sleeve that actually provides legit support! Be careful and follow where to measure for this one, it's different than the others listed from other sellers. I measured exactly 9.5" which was the cut off for small to medium. As an athletic, lady with fit arms I went with the small and it's perfect, others exceptional support and it's not too small. The medium would definitely have been to big for me.
customer_reviews.author: Lissa Clemmons

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: The sleeve works well to compress the tendons around the elbow and significantly reduce discomfort during exercise. I've even been able to go back to performing pull ups! The company's sizing recommendations seem right on the money as the sleeve fits me perfectly after measurement. I wish I could put it in the washing machine but rinsing it once per week isn't too much of a hassle compared to the benefits!
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: The right amount of compression with ease of use
customer_reviews.text: I use these for weight lifting. With some movements my elbows were often sore, but now my elbows are supported with just the right amount of compression and I can push even harder without risking injury. They also keep the muscles warm without overheating. I find them very comfortable. They are now a part of my weight lifting gear!
customer_reviews.author: Virginia Sue

customer_reviews.title: Works surprisingly well
customer_reviews.text: It seems that every time I buy any kind of compression products, they are always to loose and, therefore, ineffective. I have very painful tennis elbow, and was pretty desperate for any kind of relief. I measured my elbow and ordered the appropriate size, and it fits great! It really helps relieve the pain in my elbow. I'm super happy.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle

customer_reviews.title: Useful, but too small for me
customer_reviews.text: Originally, I bought these for myself, and followed the buying advice for their fit as closely as I could, but when I received them I found they were just too small to be useful for me. That is too small in length and width for my sized elbows. However, they are a great fit for my wife. She found they provided her great relief for her elbow aches and pains. I might yet get a larger size for myself.
customer_reviews.author: MWM

customer_reviews.title: Dull, throbbing ache in elbow is gone!
customer_reviews.text: I always had a dull ache in my elbow that got really bad during knitting and gaming at my PC. I dont lift super heavy weights or play tennis. I do work out but my elbow mainly hurt from knitting and PC gaming. Decided to try the Compression support and i used the size guide and got a medium. It was comfortable and eased the pain in about half an hour! I am very happy with it. I highly recommend this.
customer_reviews.author: DT

customer_reviews.title: awesome brace and quick customer service
customer_reviews.text: Awesome brace. Great customer service. Since I have an in-between elbow size of 9.5 in, I initially ordered a size small brace, which turned out to be to tight. The customer service responded quickly when I contacted them. Now I am wearing a medium size brace. It slides off once in a while but generally does a great job of supporting my injured working elbow. I am able to perform more tasks with the brace on and I sleep with it. I am considering to get another one so that I can rotate them for washing as it can get sweaty in the summer months.
customer_reviews.author: A. Tang

customer_reviews.title: BEST Fitting Elbow Brace
customer_reviews.text: I looked all over the internet to find my husband a elbow brace that went above and below the elbow. Not just a narrow wrap around, he needed more support plus his arm is 13" . This Kunto Fitness Elbow Compression Brace fit the bill! It does everything it says it does along with the fit. The large fits him perfect, he can wear it all day. I would highly recommend this.
customer_reviews.author: janet bailey

customer_reviews.title: Very effective
customer_reviews.text: Golfer's Elbow seems to linger. I've been doing PT but it gets injured easily. I've found this support works and helps reduce pain and discomfort. I use it when I'm moving things and liable to injury my elbow. Or, when I've irritated it and my elbow needs to take a break. You still need to do your PT but I've found this brace helpful and glad I have it when I need it.
customer_reviews.author: EveryManJack

customer_reviews.title: Works great, fabulous customer service.
customer_reviews.text: I tore my radial tendon a couple of years ago and thought it was all healed, I was wrong. Too much golf and too many years of wear and tear (pun intended) isn't a great combination! I purchased this elbow sleeve in medium per the size chart guidelines. I used it twice and both times it slid down my arm. I contacted the seller and they sent me a new one in small which is perfect. It works great, I play with no pain and it fits under my long sleeve shirts better than a bulky strap. Five stars for great customer service!
customer_reviews.author: S. Reece

customer_reviews.title: Just ok, but not great
customer_reviews.text: Minimal effect on tendinitis for elbow area compression. It looks ok, and seems to be made well, but is too elastic to be therapeutic for recovery (IMHO). I ended up buy some 7mm thick compression sleeves. That feel like they are working much better, but still don’t hinder circulation. Maybe it was just my personal preference.

customer_reviews.title: Support is good, elastics an issue
customer_reviews.text: The support is good, as is range of motion is good. Pain relief is good too. BUT!!!!!! the elastics at each end of the brace to hold it up/on are sewn in and round which causes circulation issues after a short time. I know I have the correct size so it isn't too small for me. The circulation problem probably would not be so bad if the elastics we flat and smooth.
customer_reviews.author: Robert A. Gregory

customer_reviews.title: Not Enough Compression
customer_reviews.text: I bought this elbow brace to help reduce the discomfort from tennis elbow. Although by elbow measured 10.5” the medium size was much too loose. In addition the material seems too thin to provide adequate compression compared with other sleeves I have tried. The price is a bit high too since it only includes one brace as opposed to a pair.
customer_reviews.author: Dana

customer_reviews.title: This is the best for my golfers elbow!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased one similar at CVS it was awful didn't fit correctly didn't help at all, I received the Kunto and put it on it was a perfect fit, and feel for what they call golfers elbow. I went to the golf range to hit some balls it is at impact were I feel the most pain this was a great relief, still some slight pain but nothing compared to the sharp pain I was having before. Thanks to all at Kunto for making a wonderful product!
customer_reviews.author: Smack

customer_reviews.title: Great Support for my Sore Elbow
customer_reviews.text: I use the elbow sleeve for support of my sore elbow during several different activities and it has been great at keeping my elbow active and pain free. I liked it enough that I bought a second one to keep with my exercise equipment to make sure I had it while exercising. I was somewhat skeptical at first but it really does help.
customer_reviews.author: Coachjoe

customer_reviews.title: Good enough that I bought a second one
customer_reviews.text: Nive brace, comfortable and provides good support for my routine light construction work. Originally bought one for my left elbow, which was painful. Liked it well enough that I bought a second one for the right side. Colors are pretty cool too. Colleagues call me "bionic man." I tell them I look more like I'm out of the original "Tron" movie (yes, I'm 60 years old and saw that when it came out during my high school/college days). Anyway, overall a good product.
customer_reviews.author: D Ray C'ham

customer_reviews.title: I was very pleasantly surprised at how much more comfortable my elbow is
customer_reviews.text: I am a senior that rides a bike daily. My ulnar nerve became irritated at the elbow, and I had to practically put my arm in a sling to ride. I bought this elbow compression support to see if it would benefit my elbow. I was very pleasantly surprised at how much more comfortable my elbow is. I am wearing it all day; not just when I am riding but throughout all my daily activities. It definitely has relieved 80% of my discomfort. I am hopeful that doing exercise and giving it rest I'll have a full recovery.
customer_reviews.author: Six

customer_reviews.title: item measurement chart way off
customer_reviews.text: I measured my elbow at the joint as indicated which showed a medium. The elbow was a little too tight and the portion on both my forearm and bicep were way too tight for comfort. I cut into the material trying to make it wearable and it was still too tight. These are sized way too small. I bought two and had to throw them both away as unusable. A big waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: bruce

customer_reviews.title: Best elbow support I had
customer_reviews.text: This elbow support is exactly what I was looking for. My right elbow started to hurt since some time, to the point that I couldn't perform a proper workout. I tried a few other braces, but something was always wrong. This one is the last one I will ever buy - size is right, tightness is right; it doesn't stop my blood circulation like others did, the preasure is just right and I feel no pain whn the brace is on. I bought size S; my under-elbow measurement is 9.5" - for the reference.
customer_reviews.author: Joanna H.

customer_reviews.title: Size down
customer_reviews.text: My measurement was 10” but it didn’t seem right that I would need a medium based on the chart. I’m glad I listened to others and sized down to a small. It fits perfect. It took a couple hours of wearing it to feel any difference but it does help. I’ve been in terrible pain from tennis elbow so I was glad to get some relief.
customer_reviews.author: Slantz

customer_reviews.title: Tip for Tennis Elbow
customer_reviews.text: Fold this in half and wear it right below your elbow (upper forearm). This gives nice firm support for tennis elbow. Wearing it as it is doesn't help much as you don't need any pressure actually on or above the elbow. I wear mine 24 hours a day, just bought another to switch out while one gets washed. Only good support I found after dealing with this for 2 months. This will help heal it faster.
customer_reviews.author: Right Stuff

customer_reviews.title: Helps reduce elbow pain during workouts
customer_reviews.text: Have been experiencing some pain around my elbow when lifting and doing pull ups. This does seem to help provide some relief and support during my workouts. I'm an average sized female, athletic build, and went with a Small. After about an hour, it pinches just a little bit around the bicep at the top, but otherwise it's a perfect fit. If I were reordering, I'd still stick with this size to get the needed compression.
customer_reviews.author: AC

customer_reviews.title: Relief from excruciating pain
customer_reviews.text: I am using this sleeve for my golfer’s elbow pain. It’s very comfortable. Does not restrict movement. It’s soft yet allows for some resistance. It’s not a cure all though it sure helps a great deal. I’ve had a little difficulty with sizing bc there is some give after wearing. The owner was truly one of a handful whom understands what great service is. Solved my problem and even followed up to boot. I am very happy with my elbow sleeve and plan on purchasing another as backup. Thanks!
customer_reviews.author: Bear

customer_reviews.title: Not particularly good
customer_reviews.text: I followed the instructions for measurements to figure out my size and according to the chart I was supposed to use the small, it was too big, it wasn’t even kind of snug, my husband who’s arms are double mine, it fit him but with no significant hold or support.
customer_reviews.author: Gillian De Freitas

customer_reviews.title: Great compression but already coming apart
customer_reviews.text: The results/ relief is phenomenal. I've been diagnosed with tennis elbow, carpal tunnel and cubital tunnel syndromes. Wearing this provides nearly immediate relief. I am a bit disappointed in the quality. I measured my arm before purchasing and selected the size that fit the measurements most appropriately. Within the first week of wearing, I've noticed the top band/ seam is unraveling and the elastic is broken. Perhaps the next size up would have been more appropriate but the measurement recommendation was of my elbow joint, not my bicep. I'm also concerned the next size up may not provide sufficient compression.
customer_reviews.author: Adam Jaster

customer_reviews.title: Worked for me!
customer_reviews.text: Had ulner nerve compression in both arms. It was worse at night. My doctor wanted me to get expensive tests done but I was convinced I only needed splints. Used these every night for a couple of weeks and now my arms and elbows feel a lot better. This product fits me well. It is a little tight, but it is designed this way. They never slipped and were comfortable to wear. Thank you for making this product.
customer_reviews.author: OHMAMA1203

customer_reviews.title: Very nice but runs small
customer_reviews.text: I like that it stays in place but it’s a bit snug so I can only wear it a short period of time. I bought size medium based on their chart. It’s tight on both ends. I decided to keep it anyways Hoping that I can stretch it a bit. It’s very good quality I only wished it didn’t run small.
customer_reviews.author: TKD grandma

customer_reviews.title: Not good for tennis elbow.
customer_reviews.text: I have pretty bad tennis elbow. I was hoping this would help alleviate some pain especially while at the gym. The sleeve did not provide enough pressure just south of the elbow to do anything for me. The sleeve is comfortable enough to wear all day and even in the gym, I just got nothing from it. If there was an adjustable strap at the bottom of the elbow to increase pressure there it may have been helpful.
customer_reviews.author: Barbara Duty

customer_reviews.title: Not bad
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. I wore it once since receiving yesterday (I’m an Occupational therapy intern) and it was moderately comfortable. I removed the tag after having worn it all day and that seemed to make some difference. I did notice a difference when wearing a looser fitting sleeved shirt—feels better. But I’m waiting to see how it helps when i get those really painful moments of tennis elbow.
customer_reviews.author: Angelina Tyner

customer_reviews.title: Great sleeve! Not!
customer_reviews.text: My second elbow sleeve and I like it better than the first one (they made some improvements, and I liked the first one a lot). I tried the Zensah and had to return it, no comparison for me. Follow up: This sleeve barely lasted a month before getting stretched out. Very disappointing. The first one I bought is still working well, the blue and orange.
customer_reviews.author: Lynne Bush

customer_reviews.title: elbow brace
customer_reviews.text: This is the second brace that I have ordered, only because the first one fell out of my car on a road trip. This brace helped considerably with the discomfort from tennis elbow. It took months to get past tennis elbow, but this brace made it much more comfortable and gave added support when I was doing something that was going to jeopardize my progress. I managed to re-injure my arm over the summer, so I'm back in the brace for a while. I recommend trying one of these - they really do help.
customer_reviews.author: F. Gast

customer_reviews.title: I love my Kunto elbow compression sleeve
customer_reviews.text: I'm suffering elbow pain arising from playing drums. I don't wear these sleeves while playing, instead I wear them during the day at work, or sometimes at night when asleep. I don't feel like the support is quite enough for playing, but is just right for “day after” pain relief. They are very comfortable (I almost forget that I’m wearing them), and they actually look quite sharp!!
customer_reviews.author: wahoodoss

customer_reviews.title: Does its job and it doesn't look like a bandage.
customer_reviews.text: The Kunto Brace is being used for my Bursitis and I recently had it drained. The surgeon said I need to put a pressure bandage on it and it is keeping the inflammation and swelling away. It is comfortable enough for me to keep it on for about 23 hours a day. Since this is a pressure bandage do measure your arm. Take a string wrap it around your arm, measure string where it ended. Size is everything for this product.
customer_reviews.author: J.Y

customer_reviews.title: comfortable, unobtrusive, easy to clean
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for tendonitis in my forearm/elbow area. It works well and I wear it often. Does not interfere with golf (scores have improved actually) and I also wear it for computer work and yard work. No complaints and would definitely recommend this and try their other products if I had the need.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. G

customer_reviews.title: Not bad
customer_reviews.text: I tried 4 different arm compression sleeves for relief from tennis elbow and this was the first and more pricey of them I tried. Its not bad but found others that are longer and more comfortable with two in the box instead of just one like this one came at less cost.
customer_reviews.author: R. Sturdivant

customer_reviews.title: Not my favorite, but works as described - mild compression
customer_reviews.text: I bought this hoping it would be comfortable enough to wear all day. It generally is OK for that but if you're using it while sitting, e.g. typing all day - I found that it felt like I had rug burn where my elbow was hitting my arm rest. I'll probably keep using it for things like gardening, but not for day to day for support which is really why I bought it. I didn't try it while playing tennis since I have an adjustable/firmer brace for that, but I'm not sure it offers enough compression at the right spots for something that active.
customer_reviews.author: J. L. Heeter

customer_reviews.title: Not a pair
customer_reviews.text: Be away that you are paying only for ONE! This is NOT a pair, although in the package it says pair they are sending only ONE SLEEVE.
customer_reviews.author: No name

product_meta.title: Kunto Fitness Elbow Brace Compression Support Sleeve (Shipped From USA) for Tendonitis, Tennis Elbow, Golf Elbow Treatment - Reduce Joint Pain During Any Activity!
feature_bullets: PHENOMENAL PROTECTION: Kunto elbow braces apply even pressure across your elbow joint, which provides relief from ailments such as arthritis, tendonitis, joint inflammation, tennis elbow, golf elbow, and other elbow pain. Prevent injury and tackle what life throws your way!

KEEP ACTIVE: Stay supported no matter the activity, whether that’s Tennis, Golf, Baseball, Basketball, Crossfit, Weightlifting / Powerlifting, or Volleyball! Maintain peak performance & full range of arm motion!

INCREDIBLE CONSTRUCTION: Our elbow sleeves are created to provide superior support, comfort, and relief without compromising your mobility. Tight, form fitting and breathable compression fabric maintains joint stability while avoiding the itchiness of neoprene supports.
TRUE FIT (NO SLIP) –Our fabric weave provides the perfect form fit around your elbow, allowing you to benefit from premium elbow support without suffering from sleeves that are too constricting

MANUFACTURER’S WARRANTY: We're here to provide superior service. If you’re not happy after buying new, simply contact Kunto Fitness. If we can't fix your problem, we'll give you 100% of your money back! We're that confident in the quality of our elbow sleeves. With a guarantee like that, why look anywhere else? (One Sleeve per Quantity Ordered)

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
